de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.standard

Class StandardCardTerminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.CommonCardTerminal
      • de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.standard.StandardCardTerminal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICardTerminal, de.intarsys.tools.attribute.IAttributeSupport, de.intarsys.tools.event.INotificationSupport

    public class StandardCardTerminal
extends CommonCardTerminal
implements de.intarsys.tools.event.INotificationSupport
    The abstraction of a single terminal, optionally containing a token, connected to the system.

    The standard implementation maps directly to the native PCSC API. The initial IPCSCContext is defined by the IPCSCCardReader instance. Monitoring the card reader is started immediately in a thread of its own. Upon connecting, this implementation will create a new IPCSCContext AND a IPCSCConnection. This is done for maximum decoupling and PCSC platform and version independence (some platforms may serialize requests to the same context).

    StandardCardTerminal is used in a multithreaded environment.
